question: Identify which one of the given pair of options is correct with respect to Down's syndrome and Turner's syndrome.

| Option | Down's syndrome symptoms | Turner's syndrome symptoms |
|---|---|---|
| (a) | Gynaecomastia in man | Short-statured individual |
| (b) | Round head, partially open mouth | Overall masculine development |
| (c) | Broad palm, physical and mental development retarded | Sterile females with rudimentary ovaries |
| (d) | Additional copy of an X-chromosome | Absence of an X-chromosome |
explanation: Option (c) correctly matches the symptoms: Down's syndrome includes physical/mental retardation and broad palm. Turner's syndrome results in sterile females with rudimentary ovaries.
